&teiHeader; &facsimile;
45 [Mi&yogh;hel].[This legend I have published before in 'Lemcke, Jahrbuch für rom. und engl. phil., 1874.']
SEynt MI&yogh;hel þe Archaungel : and is felawes also,
huy beoth bi-tweone ore louerd and us : to schewi &yogh;wat we schulle do.
Ane day huy habbez in þe &yogh;ere : þoru&yogh; al cristinedom.
þoru&yogh; fair miracle of seint Mi&yogh;hel : þe day a man[al. me] furst nom.
In þe one ende of Apuyle : a gret hul þare was and hei&yogh;
þat þe hul gargan is i-cleoped : for a man þat þare was nei&yogh;,
þat gargan i-cleoped was— : þe hul þare-fore hatte so.
þis gargan was wel riche man : and in gret power i-do.
hit bi-feol þreo hundret &yogh;er : and euene twenti ri&yogh;t
Aftur þat ore louerd for us : In is Moder was a-lij&yogh;t,
Þat garganes reoþeren : and oþure bestes I-nowe
A Morewenes op-on þe hei&yogh;e hulle : to heore lesewe heom drowe.
An eue þis ruþerene wenden hom : as heore wone was, ech-one.
Bote o bole, þat he louede muche : was bi-hynden al one :
Opon þe hexte toret of þe hul : þe bole wel euene drov&yogh;.
And þo þe louerd hine miste an euen : a-nuyd he was i-nov&yogh;;
With him he nam men i-nowe : and sou&yogh;te into al þat lond :
Opon þe hexte hurste of al þe hulle : atþe laste he him fond.
he nam one aruwe envenimed : in grete wrathe I-nov&yogh;
And schet to þis selie bole : and with grete strencþe i-nov&yogh;.[al. drou&yogh;]
Ake þis Arewe tornede euene a-&yogh;ein : to him þat hire schet,
And smot him, ase it in wreche were : deope wounde and gret.
Nov was þat a wonder Arewe : and wonder wei heo sou&yogh;te!
I-ne kepte nou&yogh;t leorni so forto scheote : ne swuch arewe þat man me brou&yogh;te.
A wonder schere-wynd heo was on : womme &yogh;wat heo þou&yogh;te!
Ake euere me þinchez he þat hire schet : þe game sore a-bou&yogh;te.—
þat folk þat þare-a-boute stod : in grete wonder was;
to þe bischope huy wenden anon : and tolden him al þat cas.
þe bischop was in grete fere : and in grete þou&yogh;te stod;
A tokningue it was, he wuste wel : of vuele oþur of guod :
he hiet al þe contreye a-boute : In oresones anon-ri&yogh;t to beo
And þre dawes in fastingue al-so : þis tokningue forto seo.
Seint MI&yogh;hel after þene þridde day : to þe bischope he com,
And seide, "hou þinchez þe of þis dede? : was it a wonder dom?
Ne þinche ov no wonder þar-of : for mi wille it was, i-wis :
For Ichulle witie wel þulke stude : þat in mine warde is;
And In þusse manere ich it schewi eov : þat &yogh;e þe soþe i-seo,
And þat &yogh;e honouri þulke stude : for is wardein ichulle beo."
¶ þe bischop with procession : swyþe fair and hende,
For-to honouri þulke holie stude : mildeliche he gan i-wende.
A noble churche huy founden þare : with walles faire and proute;
huy ne dorsten nou&yogh;t þare-nei&yogh; come : heore preiere huy duden with-oute.[v. 41-2 spurious?]
þare-aftur-ward al þat folk of þe lond : þat I-cristned were
Aldai comen to þulke hulle : heore beden to bidde þere.—
Sethþe [it ful][om.] þare-after-ward : þat Saracines þare come
And weorreden þe cristine men : and bataylle a-&yogh;ein heom nome :
þo het þe bischop of[al. al] þat folk : þulke dayes þreo
to seint MI&yogh;hel bidden faste : and in fastingue al-so beo.
þe þridde ny&yogh;t seint Mi&yogh;hel : to þe bischope cam eft-sone,[MS. eft ftsone]
And seide, "lat &yogh;arki al þi folk : þe bataille for-to done.
þat &yogh;e to-day þare-Inne beon : ri&yogh;t atþe feorþe tyde,
And with eov Ichulle þare beo : sum-&yogh;ware þare-bi-side."
þe bischop was þo glad i-nou&yogh;. : þat folk was sone &yogh;are,
þe tyme þat he hadde i-set : to þe batayle forto fare.
TO-gadere huy smiten opon þe hulle : ake it was ido a-non :
for þare cam a gret deork cloude : and ouer-caste heom ech-on,
And þe leitingue smot þere and þere : þe luþere men to grounde;
Six hundret it a-slov of heom : in wel luytel stounde.
heore felawes flowen faste a-non : and ascapeden onneþe;
þare nas non þat ne was longue sijk : oþur deide in strongue deþe.
þus seint Mi&yogh;hel sturede him þo : a-mong heom feor and ner.
þo was it soth þat seint Dauid : seide in þe sauter :
"þat ore [louerd] makez is Aungles : ase gostes fleojnde,
And heom þat beoth is ministres : ase fuyr berninde."
Godes ministres aungles beoth : seint Mi&yogh;hel and oþere mo;
þat ase gostes flowen þo vn-seie : in fourme of fuyre þo.
A wonder game huy pleiden þere— : þat mi&yogh;te segge heore fon;
Betere heom hadde at hom i-beo : and i-piked heore ton!
¶ þis cristine Men a-morewe : &yogh;arkeden heom fule wel
And wenden to þis holie hul : to þonki seint Mi&yogh;hel.
þo founden huy ane churche þere : swyþe quoynte a rerd.
þe bischop was þo glad I-nov&yogh; : and sumdel he was a-ferd :
he nuste hou þe churche cam : ne ho hire hadde a-rerd þere,
Ne &yogh;weþer seint Mi&yogh;hel wolde : þat heo i-halewed were—
For him þou&yogh;te þat hit was ri&yogh;t : to halewi churchene newe.
Seint Mi&yogh;hel wel &yogh;eorne he bad : þat was is freond wel trewe,
þat he heom sende sum tokningue : &yogh;wat he scholde þarof do;
þreo dawes he let þat folk fasten : and heore beden bide al-so.
&YOGH;eot cam seint Mi&yogh;hel eft-sone : to þe bischope þere,
And seide, "ne þench nou&yogh;t on mine churche : þat ich let mi-seolf a-rere!
For ich habbe þe churche a-rerd : and I-halewed al-so.
And þar-of þov schalt signe i-finde : &yogh;wane þov comest þere-to:
For wiend In atþe est-porche : and ase ich habbe i-gon
Mine fet þov schalt finde I-sene : ri&yogh;t in þe Marbre-ston.
Sing þare þine hei&yogh;e-masse : and &yogh;if þat folk also
Ore louerdes flesch and is blod : &yogh;wane þe masse is ido!"
¶ Þe bischop wel sone a-Morewe : to þe churche him drov&yogh;,
And þis folk al-so with him : with offringue fair I-nov&yogh;.
At þe est-porche huy wenden In : and in þe Marbre-ston
þe stapes huy founden I-sene : ase seint Mi&yogh;hel hadde igon.
Innore-more huy wenden &yogh;uyt : weouedes huy founden þreo,
With rede palles huy weren i-heoled : þe faireste þat mi&yogh;ten beo:
Ore swete lauedies was þat on : þat men scholden to bidde,
þat oþur seint Iohanes þe baptist[MS. bastist] : And seint peteres þat þridde.
¶ þe bischop song is masse þere : and sethþe atþen ende
þat folk he dude hoseli al : are he wolde þanne wende.
þat folk to þulke holie stude : aldai faste drou&yogh;;
And ore louerd dude þare ofte a-day : fair Miracle I-nov&yogh;.
So þat þe pope, þat was þo : þoru&yogh; þe Cardinales rede
For honour of þulke stude : and seint Mi&yogh;heles holie dede,
And also for þe Miracle : [þat] þoru&yogh; seint Mi&yogh;hel com,
Mi&yogh;heles-masse-day he hiet halewi : þoru&yogh; al cristin-dom.—
Seint MI&yogh;hel In nouembre : hath &yogh;eot an-oþur dai,
bi-fore þe feste of seint Luc : as ich ou telle mai.
þoru&yogh; seint Mi&yogh;heles wille : ri&yogh;t ase þe oþur was,
And þoru&yogh; is heste he was bi-founde : i-hereth þoru&yogh; &yogh;wat cas.
Hit bi-feol seue hundred &yogh;er : and in þe teoþe &yogh;ere ri&yogh;t
After þat ore swete louerd : in is Moder was a-lij&yogh;t,
Þat to þe bischope Albert : seint Mi&yogh;hel cam a-ni&yogh;t
Bi-side þe Montaygne of Toumbe : ase it were in a sij&yogh;t:
Opon þe hulle of Toumbe : ane churche he him liete[r. het] a-rere,
Ri&yogh;t swuch one ase ope þulke of gargan : and þat it bi-tyme were.
þe bischop axede in &yogh;wuche stude : he scholde þe churche make.
"I-chulle þe," quath seint Mi&yogh;hel : "guode tokne þarof take:
Ane bole þov schalt þare finde : þat þeoues habbet þare i-hud,
Opon þe hei&yogh;e hulle of toumbe : þat nis nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot i-kud.
þare ase þou finst þe bole I-hud : þov schalt mine churche a-rere."
þe bischop þat wel onder-stod : and bi-gan is churche þere,
And þare a-rerde hire faire I-nov : to þe helpe of mani a man,
In þe honour of seint Mi&yogh;hel : ase hul[r. þulke] of gargan.
Opon hei&yogh;e hulles þis churchene weren : boþe of seint Mi&yogh;hel—
hei&yogh; man me þinchez he wolde beo : for he louede hulles wel.
he dude wel, for he mi&yogh;te beo : at hom opon is owe
And sittinde a-boute him wide i-seo : and þe contreie bet i-knowe,
And hom a-&yogh;ein þe sonere fleo : &yogh;wane þat he li&yogh;te lowe;
he ne þurte carie of non oþur weork : noþur to ripe ne mowe.
For he let opon eiþer hulle : areren a chapel,
Muche folk þat &yogh;eot on eorþe is : onder-stant þat wel,
And &yogh;wane huy a-rereth anie churche : to massi Inne oþur rede godspel,
Opon an hul bi custome : huy makiez of seint Mi&yogh;hel,
Ase þe Mount of seint Mi&yogh;hel : and þe Mount a-gv al-so,
And also oþere in fale studes : ho-so nimez &yogh;eme þar-to.
IN þe grete se of Occean : þe hul of Toumbe is,
þat geth a-bouten al þe world : In þat on ende, i-wis.
Al-a-boute þe hulle geth þe se. : and In þe feste-daie euere-mo
þe se. with-drauth[MS. hire w. hire] hire twies aday : þat ech man may druy&yogh;e gon
Forto honouri þulke holie stude— : and in non oþur tyme it nis
þat þe .se. ne geth al-a-boute : bote on þe feste-daie, i-wis.
¶ So bi-feol In one time : þat þe se hire with-drou&yogh;
In þe feste-dai&yogh;e of þulke stude : and folk þare wende In I-nov&yogh;:
So þat a womman grete with childe : cam In atþen ende,
And nas nou&yogh;t so swift ase oþere weren : a-&yogh;einward forto wende:
þe .se. for-closede hire sone : and heo bi-lefte with-Inne;
heo floterede þare in luyte reste : and in wel feble wunne.
So þat heo bi-lefte þare : In wonder cas I-nov&yogh;,
For-to it was on oþur &yogh;er : þat þe .se. hire with-drou&yogh;;
And hadde child þare In þe .se. : and at þe &yogh;eres ende
hol and sound with hire childe : þudere heo gan i-wiende—
I-saued heo was in þe deope .se. : þoru&yogh; þe grace of seint Mi&yogh;hel.
For-soþe, nis nouþe no man aliue : þat hire couþe habbe i-wust so wel,
Ne so hire i-fed and hire child : þat ne costnede nou&yogh;t a strav&yogh;:
For þei heo hadde fisch and drinke : &yogh;e wuten wel it was rav&yogh;.
And so to floteri in þe grete .se! : wounder, þat heo nadde i-beo ded.
Seint Mi&yogh;hel was a guod wardein : &yogh;wane we habbeth al i-sed;
Icholde ech man me hadde ane peny i-&yogh;yue : þat no couþe nou&yogh;t witen hire so!
Atþe feste-day at þe hul of Toumbe : þis dede was i-do.—
þe hul of Toumbe he is i-cleoped : for he is sumdel[MS. sundel] nare
And long, ase Man may i-seo : ane Mannes burieles fare
þat mannes bodi is Inne I-leid : &yogh;wane huy beoth here dede;
Also þilke hul is long : and nou&yogh;t wel large In brede.
And þat is, ase þe .se. hath i-bete : faste on eiþur side
And hath þat sond a-rerd up on hei&yogh; : þat men mouwen i-seo wel wide,
And þar-of Imaket ane hul : narv and long i-wis;
More þane four hondret fet : þe hul so hei&yogh; is.—
MEn synguez a-Mi&yogh;heles-masse-day : In holie churche also
Of one bataile þat seint Mi&yogh;hel : with a dragun scholde do:
þat was þe luþere lucifer : þo he was[al. þat was] is felawe
And sumdel is souerein : for-to he gan mis-drawe,
Ake þo he þat Aungel was : þoru&yogh; is wicke pruyte
Bi-cam to a luþer feond— : he bi-&yogh;at þare-with luyte!
he feol out of is hei&yogh;e sege : þat he ches a-mis,
To þe deope putte of helle : þare is wonijngue is.
fram þe hexte stude þat is : with one swenge he cam
To þe loweste stude, i-wis— : ane wonder wei he nam!
Nov sori beo he! &yogh;wat was him? : &yogh;wi ferde þe schrewe so?
he pleyde with þe fallingue tourn : so wel he couþe hine do,
Iaumbe leue he cam swenge : Into helle grounde.
A muregore In he hadde bi-fore : þat worse þare he founde!
A wonder sweng, me þinchez, he made! : his bi-&yogh;ete was ful luyte;
he may corsi euere-more : his mis-farinde pruyte.
for al-so sone as ore louerd I-maud : heouene and eorþe and helle,
he makede him furst and is felawes : ase ich ov mai here telle.
And he ase-sone ase he was imaud : he bi-gan to smite in pruyte:
Al-so hei&yogh; ase ore louerd he wolde beo : he bi-&yogh;at þare-with wel luyte.
Manie heolden faste with him : and nou&yogh;t alle of one lore:
And[al. om.] manie likeden wel is dedene : some lasse and some more,
Some ferden ase huy ne rou&yogh;ten : noþer of on .ne of oþur.
þare ne bi-lefte in heouene non of heom : ne heore maister noþer.
Seint Mi&yogh;hel was maister to driuen heom : out of heuene a-doun:
þat was þe batayle þat he made : with þe luþere dragoun.
þe maister-dragoun lucifer : and is ri&yogh;te felawes ech-on
þat faste heolden with is pruyte : he drof heom to helle anon.
Ake huy þat heolden sumdel with him : and nou&yogh;t fulliche so faste,
Out of heouene he drof heom : and In-to þe lofte heom caste,
Al here bi-neþe toward þe eorþe : þare mest tempeste is:
And þare heo schullen in tempest and[in t. and al. om.] in pine beo : to þe daye of dome, i-wis;
And ase hore gult þe more was : heore pine was[al. is] al-so,
þe worse stude heom [was] i-take : heore penaunce for-to do.
Ake to helle huy ne schullen nou&yogh;t : are domes-day i-wende;
Ak þare huy schullen after-ward : bi-leue with-outen ende.
Oþure þare weren þat for heom[r. him] : sumdel in mis-þou&yogh;te weren,
Ake natheles huy heolden betere with god : and[al. ac] vnneþe fur-bere:
þulke wenden out of heouene al-so : and a-boue þe oþure beoth,
An hei&yogh; onder þe firmament : and godes wille i-seoth,
And so schullen sumdel in pine beo : a-non to þe worldes ende,
Ake huy schullen at domes-day : a-&yogh;ein to heouene wende.
In eorthþeliche parays : some beoth &yogh;eot al-so,
And in oþur studes on eorþe : heore penaunce for-to do.—
For heore defaute in heouene : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace
Man was formest on eorþe i-wrou&yogh;t : to fulfulle þulke place.
¶ For ten ordres of Aungles : þare weren i-makede þo,
And þe teoþe ordre ful a-doun : In-to pine and wo:
And &yogh;eot þare beot ordres Nyne : and þare-fore man is i-wrou&yogh;t,
To fulfulle þe teoþe ordre : þat was out of heouene i-brou&yogh;t.
SOne so man was i-wrou&yogh;t : sunne he bi-gan to do
And fur-gulte þe murie Ioie : þat he was i-maket to:
In helle he was with lucifer : and with oþure luþere fode,
For-to ore louerd it bou&yogh;te : In flesch and in blode.
þe luþere gostes beoth a-boute : with heore luþere pouwer
To bi-traye wrechche men : and bringue into heore paunter;
And þe guode beoth al-so a-boute : with power þat heore is
For-to witien men fram sunne : þat huy ne wurchen a-mis.
Boþe þe luþere and þe guode : a-li&yogh;teth ofte a-doun
And to men in hore slepe comieth : ase In a visioun,
And scheowieth in metingue : mani a wounder dede,
Þe guode of guode þingues : and þe luþere euere of quede,
And deriez men in heore slep : and bodieth seoruwe and care,
And ofte huy ouer-liggez [men] : and[al. þat] men cleopiet þe ni&yogh;t-mare—
For þat is al heore delii&yogh;t : &yogh;wane huy mowen don men wo.
Ase þeoues huy cheoseth þe ni&yogh;t : a-boute to fleo and go.
Mest huy greuieth selie men : &yogh;wane huy liggez upri&yogh;t;
heuie huy liggez on heom i-nov : nere heom erore so lij&yogh;t:
huy liggez ase an heui stok : þat wolde ane Man a-stoffe,
þat he ne may him wawie fot ne hond : ne vnneþes ani-þing poffe.
¶ Daþeheit a swuch luþer Caumberleyn : þat a-wakez men so sore,
And god him &yogh;iue sorewe I-nou&yogh; : and euere so leng þe more,
And alle þat louiez is compaygnie! : for he nas neuere hende.
&YOGH;if ani man him louez wel : ore louerd hyne him sende.—
þe schrewene wollez also ofte : mankun to bi-trai&yogh;e,
A-li&yogh;te a-doun in mannes forme : bi ni&yogh;te and bi daye,
And liggez ofte bi wommen : ase huy weren of flesch and of blode—
Ake þulke bi-&yogh;ete þat huy bi-&yogh;itez : neuere ne cometh to guode.
And ofte in fourme of womman : a-day and eke a-ny&yogh;t
huy latez men ligge heom bi : and bi-trayez heom ou&yogh;t-ri&yogh;t—
for huy wutez wel &yogh;wuche beoz þe men : þat to folie habbeth wille:
Al-one in some deerne stude : huy stondez þanne wel stille,
And Mani fol heom lijth so bi : In wodes and in mede.
Ake þare nis non þat deth so : þat huy ne acoriez þe dede:
heore membres to-swellez sone : and some a-scapieth onneþe,
And some for-dwynez al awei : for-to huy beon i-brou&yogh;t to deþe;
More wonder it is, for-soþe : hov ani a-scapiez a-liue—
for a swiþe attri þing it is : to lefman oþur to wyue.
And ofte in fourme of wommane : In many derne weye
grete compaygnie men i-seoth of heom : boþe hoppie and plei&yogh;e,
þat Eluene beoth i-cleopede : and ofte heo comiez to toune,
And bi daye muche in wodes heo beoth : and bi ni&yogh;te ope hei&yogh;e dounes.
þat beoth þe wrechche gostes : þat out of heuene weren i-nome,
And manie of heom a-domesday : &yogh;eot schullen to reste come.
Ake þeo schrewene þat beoth in toune[in t. al. om.] : bi ni&yogh;te and bi day&yogh;e
fondieth with &yogh;wuche feolonie : huy mouwen mest men bi-traie.—
For þulke tyme þat þe feond : ore furste fader i-wan
þoru&yogh; þat appel þat he him &yogh;af : mayster he was of man;
he hadde faste al to him men i-bounde : for-to ore louerd us bou&yogh;te:
And for men weren so alle his : þe lasse of heom he rou&yogh;te,
Ne noþing he nas ginful : ase þe schrewene nouþe beoth—
for plente nis no deinte : ase we al day i-seot.
he fierde ase doth a port-doggue : I-norischet in port-toun:
for he geth ofte in prece of Men : a-mong heom op and doun,
Ne &yogh;eme ne nimeth he to men : to beorken on heom nou&yogh;t ene,
Ake a-mong men he goth stille I-nov&yogh; : bote ani man him hene:
Al-so fierde þe deuel þo : for mankun was al his,
And hadde of him[al. hem] so gret plente : he ne tolde nou&yogh;t þar-of, iwis.
he nas no-þing clib to heom : for-to a-sailli heom with wou&yogh;,
Non more þane þe port-hound : þat nei&yogh; men geth I-nou&yogh;;
Ne he nis[al. nas] noþing grim to bi-gyli men : ase he was bi-fore,[al. nouþe is]
Er þane[al. Siþþe] ore swete louerd : of Marie was i-bore.
Hadde he i-beo swuch bi-fore : ase he was er[al. haþ siþþe] i-wis,
Onneþe was þare ani Man : þat ne hadde i-beon al his.
Ake ore louerd after is deþe : In harde logge him brou&yogh;te
And teide þane schrewe faste Inov&yogh; : and daþeheit þat hit of-þou&yogh;te!
A teie doggue is clib I-nov : &yogh;wane man comez In is si&yogh;te,
And grennez and beorkez faste I-nov : and drau&yogh;th with al is mi&yogh;te;
Ake &yogh;if ani man cometh so nei&yogh; : þat he sette on him is toth,
for-soþe he bitez sore I-nov&yogh; : ase all[e] swuche doth;
he is clibbest op-on heom : þat arriet him with ston:
Ake nei&yogh; no man ne may he come : bote þat to nei&yogh; him wollez gon.
Nouþe late, sethþe he was iteid : þe deuel farez al-so:
he beorkez and grennez toward Men : ake he ne may heom nou&yogh;t do;
In is owene wrathþe he brennez : him-sulf he doth mest wo,
Ake he ne mai no man a-reche : bote ho-so wole allingues to him go.[vv. 289-290 al. om.]
And &yogh;wane ani Man cometh him so nei&yogh; : þat he mouwe him a-reche,
Bite he wole harde I-nov&yogh; : and is lessun him teche,
Þat, bote he tuyrne to amendement : and take to godes leche
And of preoste beo wel i-schriue : him worth i-don gret wreche.
¶ Hardest þe deuel bitez þe men : &yogh;wane ani comez him to
Of heom þat arreden him er : and guodnesse habbez i-do—
for þare-with Men him arrieth mest— : and &yogh;wuch so him wole with|drawe
And comez so nei&yogh; þat he him mouwe a-reche : he cachchez him wel fawe
And opon is pouwer harde bit— : his bitingues beoth wel ille.
he ne may no man, ase &yogh;e i-seoth : taken a-&yogh;ein is wille,
Nonmore þane a tei&yogh; doggue : þat is in strongue tei&yogh;e.
And &yogh;wane he ne may a-reche Men : ful wide he cast is ei&yogh;e
&YOGH;if he may ani man i-seo : þat toward him wole drawe;
he bi-guynnez a-non for-to tolli him : ase man doth his felawe—
for &yogh;wane a man ne mai : his felawe bringue him nere,
with is hond he tollez him : ase man þat seith "Ich am here."
¶ þe Deuel tollez with is hond : ase wel as doth a man,
And fif fingres þare-on he hath : þat he wel bi-sette can.
Ech of is fingres hath is name : ase we cleopiez ovre al-so.
þe leste hatte "luttle man" : for he is lest þere-to.
þe nexte finguer hatte "leche" : for &yogh;wane þe leche makez ou&yogh;t,
with þat finguer he wole hit tasti : &yogh;if it is a-ri&yogh;t i-wrou&yogh;t.
¶ "Longueman" hatte þe midleste : for he lenguest is.
þe feorþe finguer hatte "techere" : for þere-with men techez i-wis,
Ase a man þat seith "lo he þere : of &yogh;wam we speken er longue."
for mannes þoumbe strenguest is : þare-fore he hatte "þe strongue."
þanne hatte þe leste luttle man : and þe nexte hatte leche,
And sethþe þat oþur longueman : þe techare for he doth [teche],
Strongue is þe þoumbe I-cleoped : þou wost wel &yogh;wy it is:
þeos fif fingres þe deuel hath : and heore names, i-wis.
þare-with he tollez men to him : &yogh;wanne men stondez feor a-to
And with fol þou&yogh;t toward him lokiez : and nutez &yogh;wat he wollez do,
And heore Inwit heom seith : þat swyþe gret sunne it were,
And grete wille huy habbez þer-to : &yogh;if huy dorsten for fere.
¶ þe deuel stant and wolde fain : henten heom bi þe polle:
with "luttle man," is leste finguer : he bi-guynneth heom furst to tolle
And seith, "&yogh;ware-of art þou of-drad? : a luyte sunne it is"—
he makez þe sunne luyte Inov&yogh; : for þe finguer is luyte, i-wis.
&YOGH;if he ne may with is luytel finguer : ane man to sunne teche,
with is felawe he tolleth next : þat men cleopieth "leche,"
And seit, "&yogh;e, god is leche guod : and ful of milce and ore,
he wole wel hele and fur-&yogh;iue : þei þe sunne were wel more;
he nis nou&yogh;t so wrechful ase men weneth : he hath þe deore a-bou&yogh;t;
wel more sunne he wole fur-&yogh;yuen : þare-fore ne dred þe nou&yogh;t."
And bote he mouwe þare-with i-winne : he pult forth is felawe,
þe "longue finguer," þat sit him next— : þat alle weren huy to|drawe!—
And seith, "man, þov art &yogh;ung I-nov : þou mi&yogh;t libben &yogh;eot wel longue
And þine sunnes bieten wel : þei huy weren ten so strongue.
Scholdestov nouþe þine wille lete : &yogh;wat scholde þi &yogh;ungue blod?
þou mi&yogh;t libbe longue I-nov&yogh; : and a-mendi al þi mod."
Bote he[MS. &yogh;e] mouwe &yogh;eot makie man : þare-with don a-mis,
he tollez him with þe "techare" : þat is nexte felawe is.
And seith, "lo þere þilke preost : and þilke kny&yogh;t al-so
And þilke person, and manie oþure : þat more sunne habbez i-do,
And natheles huy beoth guode men : and guod lijf ledez i-nou&yogh;.
þilke man nas neuere I-bore : þat oþur-&yogh;wile ne dude sum wou&yogh;.
Seint powel with is owene hond : Manie men he slov&yogh;,
And þe Marie Maudeleine : þat[al. om.] to lecherie drov&yogh;,
Seint peter þries in one nij&yogh;t : for-sok ore louerd al-so;
And al-so loke þis oþur helewe : &yogh;wat sunne huy habbez i-do:
Ake þei huy beoth In heouene nouþe : ne worst þou neuere so hei&yogh;e.
More sunne þane þou wolt do : þov mi&yogh;t biete, are þou dei&yogh;e:
þou woldest beo holiore þane ani man. : bi-holt þe al-a-boute:
A misdede wole beo sone ibet. : &yogh;ware-of hast þou doute?"
&YOGH;if he ne may with is techare : maken is wei roume,
with is "strongue" he tollez þanne : with is schrewe þoume,
And seith, "þov art strong i-nov : more sunne to biete;
woldest þou bi-leue so murie þing? : þench þat it is swete,[al. 2 vv more.]
And biet þine sunnes aftur-ward : for þe ne faillez strenþe non;
And wel fieblore þane þou art : ofte wolleth mis-don
And sethþe doth heore penaunce : ake natheles nou&yogh;t wel strongue,
For ore louerd is euere &yogh;are : sunful Man to fongue."
In þis manere þe luþere schrewe : &yogh;wane he vnder-&yogh;it ou&yogh;t
þat men lokiez touward him : and sumdel chaungiez heore þou&yogh;t,
he tollez heom euere ner and ner : with is fingres a-rewe.
Nouþe luþer þrift on al is hond : for euere he was a schrewe!
Daþeit þat sori wolde beo : þei he were al-to-hewe!
For he bringuez to sunne mani on : and to amendement wel fewe.
Þare-fore þenchez, &yogh;wane he wole : eou to sunne puyte
And with is fingres tollez eov : and seiz þe sunne is luyte
And þat ore louerd is guod leche and milsful : and þat þou schalt libbe longue
And þat oþure sunegiez more : þat ne beoth nou&yogh;t so strongue:
A-non so &yogh;e þenchez swuch a þou&yogh;t : bi-þenchez ov þer-to
hou þe schrewe tollez eov : and with wuch finguer al-so:
Seggez him þat he ly&yogh;th loude : ho-so it dorste him telle,
Saue þat he is maister : in þe deope putte of helle;
Þat god holde him is dignete : and is grete maistrie
For-to sum riche man &yogh;iue al is guod : to bi-nimen him is baylie.
For-soþe, he deoth vuele I-nouv&yogh; : þat comez in his tollingue:
He wole him bringue euere ner ant ner : In deoppore suneguyngue,
Atenende In-to þe putte of helle : þare euere he worth fur-lore,
þat onneþe him worth þe grace : to with-drawen him bi-fore.—
þei we ne mouwen nou&yogh;t þe feondes i-seo : a-mong us huy beoth wel þicke;
And þei huy ovte of helle beon : heore pinene beoth strongue and wicke.
For huy farez ase doth þe man : þat in ane hache[al. acces] of þe feueres is:
Beo he in house oþur in fielde : is brenningue i-last, i-wis;
Feor and neor he may go : ake euere i-last is pine.
Hit is bi þe Deouele here : al-so and bi is hyne:
For þei huy ovte of helle beon : huy ne schullen nou&yogh;t so at-route
þat huy þe brenningue of helle : with heom ne bereth a-boute.—
ÞE ri&yogh;te put of helle is : a-midde þe eorþe with-Inne,
þat ore louerd it made i-wis : þat quoynte was of ginne.
heouene and eorþe he made furst : and seothe alle þing þat is.
þe Eorþe nis bote a luytel hurst : a-&yogh;ein þe ri&yogh;te heouene, i-wis.
Heouene geth al-a-boute þe eorþe : euene it mot wey&yogh;e;
A-midde ri&yogh;t heouene þe eorþe is : ase þe streon a-midde þe Ey&yogh;e.
Muche is þat on þanne more þane þat oþur : for þe leste steorre is
In heouene, ase þe bok us tellez : [more] þane al þe eorþe, i-wis.
For ho-so were an hei&yogh; bi ane steorre : &yogh;if it so mi&yogh;te beo,
So luyte wolde þe eorþe þinche : þat vnneþe he scholde it ou&yogh;t i-seo.
þe heouene geth ene a-boute : þoru&yogh; dai&yogh;e and þoru&yogh; ny&yogh;t;
þe Mone and þe steorrene with him heo berth : and þe sonne þat is so bri&yogh;t:
For þat is euene a-boue þin heued : ri&yogh;t atþe nones stounde,
Ounder þine fet euene it is : at midni&yogh;t onder þe grounde,
And cometh up &yogh;wane þe sonne a-rist : and [o]uer þe is at none;
heo makez euene þus hire cours : and comez a-boute wel sone.
Ase an Appel þe eorþe is round : so þat euere-mo
half þe eorþe þe sonne bi-schineth : hov-so it euere go,
And Noon it is bi-nethen us : &yogh;wane it is here mid-ni&yogh;t;
Ase man may þe soþe i-seo : ho-so hauez guod In-si&yogh;t:
Ase &yogh;if þov heolde ane clere candele : bi-side an Appel ri&yogh;t,
Euene half þe Appel : heo wolde &yogh;iuen hire lij&yogh;t.
[firmamenta.]EI&yogh;te firmamenz þare beoth : swuche ase we i-seoth.
þe Ouemeste is þe ri&yogh;tte heouene : in &yogh;wan þe steorrene beoth—
for godes riche is þare a-boue : þat last with-outen ende;
þarto we beoth i-maked— : god leue us þudere i-wende.
¶ þare-bi-neoþe beoth seoue firmamenz : þat euerech of heom, i-wis,
[planete.]One steorre hath with-oute mo : þat planete i-cleoped is.
Ichulle nemmen heore seoue names : and formest bi-guynne hext:
Saturnus is al a-boue : and Iupiter sethþe next,
þanne Mars bi-neoþen him : and sethþe þe sonne is,
Venus sethþe, þe clere steorre : Mercurius þanne, i-wis,
þat wel selden is of us i-sei&yogh;e : þe Mone is next þe grounde.
þoru&yogh; gret wit of clergie : heore names weren furst bi-founde:
for euerech of þeos seouene mouwen : gret wonder on eorþe do,
boþe of wederes and of fruyt : ase heore power &yogh;if þare-to.
And al-so man,[r. men þat beoth] &yogh;wane he is i-bore : onder heore power, i-wis,
Schullen habbe diuers lijf : euere ase heore vertue is :
Some lechours, some glotones : and some of oþur manere.
And natheles a man of guod Inwit : of alle he may him skere :
for þe planetes ne doth non oþur : bote &yogh;iuez in mannes wille,
To beon luþur oþur guod : ase heore uertue wole to tille,
And &yogh;iuen[r. &yogh;iuez] him al-so qualite : to don so and so;
Ake nou&yogh;t-for-þan after is inwit : ech wys man may do :
for swuch qualite no man ne hath : to beon lechor oþur schrewe,
þat he þare-with ne may him wite— : ake natheles so doth fewe.
Of þe seoue planetes al-so guod : heore power &yogh;e i-seoth,
for þe seoue Dawes in þe wyke : þare-aftur I-nemde beoth :
Of Saturnus so is satur-day : and sonen-day of þe sonne,
And of þe Mone Monen-day : &yogh;if &yogh;e wel rikeni konne;
Of one planete euerech day : In þe wike i-cleoped is,
On englisch oþur latyn : bote &yogh;e telle a-mis.
And for mars and saturnus : In heore power luþere beoth
And luyte guod on eorþe doth : ase þis clerkes i-seoth,
þare-fore Men schoniez muche : þene satur-day bi-guynne,
And þene tywesday, euerech [werc][om.] : to guode ende it forto wynne.
Among alle þe planetes : þe sonne a-midde heom is
Ase is þe kyng a-Midde is men : to conseili heom i-wis :
Al-so þe sonne, þat heo mouwe : schyne a-boute eche-on :
for alle habbez lij&yogh;t of hire : and with-oute hire nou&yogh;t on.
Ase man may bi þe Mone i-seo : þe &yogh;wyle heo is neowe ri&yogh;t :
A luyte rondel ase a sikel : Men seoth þar-on li&yogh;t,
And al þat oþur del with-Inne : swiþe blak as a rauon[as a r. on the margin.] it is.
Ri&yogh;t so blac is al þe mone : of hire-sulf, i-wis,
Bote þare ase þe sonne schynez : þat hire li&yogh;t &yogh;if hire al
And Makez hire schyne a-boute : bri&yogh;tore þane ani cristal.
for &yogh;wanne þe sonne schynez on cristal : oþur in watere cler,
A gret leome it &yogh;if out a-&yogh;ein : and schynez feor and ner :
Al-so fareth þe Mone, i-wis : þe sonne schynez doun ri&yogh;t
Euene on hire and heo a&yogh;ein : and a-mong us sent hire li&yogh;t.
And for þe sonne is feor a-boue : ri&yogh;t at-fore þe prime,
bi-neoþen hire þe Mone is euene : and þe sonne schyne[z] bi-tyme
Al In þe ouere side of þe Mone : and hider-ward nowi&yogh;t :
þanne ne seo we nou&yogh;t of hire : ne heo ne &yogh;ifth no li&yogh;t.
So þat þe sonne bi-fore geth : luyte and luyte, i-wis,
And schyneth on þe hiderore half : on þulke þat ner him is:
Heo makez þe Mone wexe so : luyte and luyte bi stounde,
So þat þe Mone is hei&yogh;ful : &yogh;wane þe sonne geth to grounde.
þe Mone bi-gynnez bi este a-rise : euene a-&yogh;en hire ri&yogh;t[ri&yogh;t on the margin.],
þat in þulke half to-ward us : þe sonne sent hire lij&yogh;t :
þanne is þe ouere half deork : and þe hiderore half al bri&yogh;t
And sent hire leome hidere to us : and schinez al þe ni&yogh;t.
So þat heo drauth hire[on the margin.] feor þe sonne : and luyte and luyte is blak,[al. a-bac]
And euere is cler toward þe sonne : and þat oþur del is blak;
And ate laste toward us is al blac : atþe monþes ende
And cler a-boue ase is þe sonne : þat to hire li&yogh;t deth sende.
So þat þe sonne in þe haluendele : schinez euere-mo,
&YOGH;wat a-boue and &yogh;wat bi-neoþe : hov-so hit euere go—
Ase man may i-seo bi ane candele : þat is bi-side ane balle,
þat &yogh;ifth li&yogh;t on þat haluendel : hov-so it euere falle.
And &yogh;wane þe sonne is onder þe eorþe : and þe Mone a-boue a-ny&yogh;t,
bi-side þe eorþe in þat on half : &yogh;eot þe sonne sent hire li&yogh;t.—
¶ An hundret siþe and fiue and sixti : ase it is i-write,
þe sonne is more þane þe eorþe : ho-so it wole i-wite;
And þe eorþe is more þane þe Mone : nye siþe, i-wis.
þe Mone þinchez wel þe more : for heo so nei&yogh; us is.
þe sonne is herre þane þe Mone : More þane schwche þreo
þane it beo heonnes to þe Mone— : þe lasse heo is to seo.
Muche is bi-twene heouene and eorþe : for þe man þat mi&yogh;te go
euereche daye fourty mile : and &yogh;eot sumdel mo,
He ne scholde nou&yogh;t to þe hexte heouene : þat &yogh;e alday i-seoth,
comen in ei&yogh;te þousende &yogh;er : þere ase þe steorrene beoth;
And þei adam, ore furste fader : hadde bi-gonne a-non
þo þat he was furst i-mad : and toward þe heouene i-gon
And hadde eche daie fourti mile : euene opri&yogh;t i-go,
he ne hadde nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot to heuene i-come : bi a þousende mile and mo.
Sikere &yogh;e beon isegge &yogh;eov soth : I-leue ho-so i-leue—
hov schulle we þat comiez so late : after Adam and eue?
Ake &yogh;wane a man is on eorþe ded : and is soule beo guod,
heo nath with hire non heuinesse : of flesche[MS. of flechs of flesche] ne of blod :
&YOGH;if heo is þanne with-oute sunne : heo hath Aungles cuynde
And mai beo nouþe here and þer : ase quik ase mannes muynde.
for ase &yogh;e I-seoth þe li&yogh;tingue : out of þe cloudene i-wende
þat comieth of þat on half of þe world : and al-so sone in þe oþur ende,
wel smart-loker scheot ane mannes soule : &yogh;e more þane swuche seuene,
&YOGH;if heo is oute of sunne : þene ri&yogh;te wei into heouene.
Ake wel sonere he may to helle come— : þare-fore it is i-sene
þat wel mo to helle wendez : &yogh;e ich drede swuche tene.
[Elementa.]BI-neoþe þe loweste heuene : þat þe mone is on i-brou&yogh;t,
so beoth þe foure Elemenz : of &yogh;wan we beoth i-wrou&yogh;t.
Next þe Mone þat fuyr is hext— : ech-one huy beoth rounde—
þe eir is þanne next bi-neothe : and tillez ri&yogh;t to þe grounde,
Sethþe is watur, and sethþe þe eorþe— : þeos beoth foure, i-wis;
of &yogh;wan man and eche quic þing : for-soþe I-maked is.
Ore louerd in ech-on of þis foure : al dai scheweth is mi&yogh;te,
Ase &yogh;e mowe in þe stude of fuyre : I-seo a wonder si&yogh;te,
Scheote as þei it a steorre were : bi þe lofte an hei&yogh;,
Ake þe steorrene beoth feorre a-boue : for þat is sumdel nei&yogh;.
þe sonne may here a-mong us : gret strencþe and mi&yogh;te do :
heo drauth up þe kuynde of þe watere : and of þe eorþe al-so,
he drau&yogh;th up of[MS. op] þe eorþe in druye wedere : ase it were a druye breth,
So þat þoru&yogh; hete of þe sonne : a-boue[MS. aboute] þe eir it geth,
And &yogh;wane it comez a-mong þe fuyre : sone it bi-gynnez forto tiende
And al berninde it scheot forth : þat hit beo i-bar[n]d to ende.
þare-fore men ne i-seoth no swuch þing : bote it beo in hete.
[Fuigur.]¶ Li&yogh;tingue comez al-so þare-of : &yogh;wane it comez to wete :
for al þat ilke druye breth : þat is so i-drawe an hei&yogh;
þoru&yogh; hete þat was bi-fore : and a cloude þat[al. om.] þare was[al. is] nei&yogh;,
A-non so it is a-fuyre : it scheot þoru&yogh; þe cloude,
And þe &yogh;wile it is in þe watere : it goþeleth swyþe loude.
Ase &yogh;if a man nome ane sclabbe of Ire : þat glowynde were a-fuyre
And pulte in watere, it wolde goþeli loude : þat men mi&yogh;ten it feor i-huyre.[Tonitruum.]
Al-so þat fuyr up an hei&yogh; : þat bi þe cloude is i-tend;
hit goþelez in þe watere loude : as it þoru&yogh;-out I-went—
And þat is þe þondre, i-wis : and siker non oþur þing;
And &yogh;wane þat fuyr scheot þoru&yogh;-out : þat is þe li&yogh;ting,
And þat scheot a-brod þoru al þe world— : þat comez aftur þe dunte;
And natheles it þinchez bi-fore : for it ne may nou&yogh;were at-stunte.
&YOGH;if here were an hei&yogh; stepel : and a man a-boue sete
And men i-sei&yogh;en him smiten al an hei&yogh; : guode duntes and grete,
þou mi&yogh;test him seo wel longue smite : þe duntes with þine ei&yogh;e
Are þov scholdest þene dunt i-heore : &yogh;if he were ou&yogh;t hei&yogh;e—
for man mai i-seo wel feor a þing : a-non so it is ido,
&YOGH;if þare nis no-þing bi-tweone : ake man ne may nou&yogh;t i-heore so.
&YOGH;wane þat fuyr comez into þe &yogh;water : gret noyse a-non þare is,
Ake men ne heorez it nou&yogh;t a-non : for it is so feor, i-wis;
¶ þe li&yogh;tingue we i-seoth a-non : &yogh;wane it is þoru&yogh; i-brou&yogh;t—
þare-fore men þinchez it comez bi-fore : bote natheles it ne doth nou&yogh;t :
for &yogh;wane þe li&yogh;tingue is i-come : A-non we habbez þe si&yogh;te,
Ake þet sovn ne may nou&yogh;t : so sone a-doun to us a-li&yogh;te.—
Novþe nis þe druy&yogh;e breth of eorþe : neuere with-oute hete
Idrawe up, þat comez bi-fore : ne a-queint with-oute wete :
þare-fore bote after hete : man ne schal no þondre i-seo,
And þat þe weder smite in wete : for non-oþur ne mai it beo.
So þat man schal in puyr somer : selde þondre i-huyre :
For þer is þanne selde wete : to maken quenchingue of fuyre;
Ne in puyr winter no-þe-mo : for þanne nis non hete
To drawe up þe drou&yogh;þe of þe eorþe : for þe muchele wete.
þare-fore Men seggez þat wynter-þondre : selde man schal guod i-seo,
For he ne may neuere come : bote þat weder onkuynde beo.
Ake bi-tweone somer and wynter : ase in Aueril and may,
And eft-sone fram heruest : forto seint Clementes day,
þanne is þe þondre kuynde Inov : and li&yogh;tingue al-so :
For þanne is þat weder wet : and ofte hot þar-to.—
&YOGH;e mouwen axi, &yogh;wane it[al. om.] þundre is : I-meingt of fuyr in wete,
hov is þat hit a-quellez men : ofte bi weye and strete,
And smit a-doun wel grete treon : and deth wel mani a wonder?
þare-fore ich mot eov more telle : of kuynde of þe þonder.
ÞO ore louerd þolede on eorþe deth : and bond þene deuel for man
A[n]d debruysde helle-&yogh;ates : with þondre þudere he cam.
þare-fore euereft Aftur-ward : &yogh;ware-so þe deouelene beo,
Of þondre huy beoth so sore a-ferd : þat huy nutez &yogh;wodere to fleo;
And huy þat woniez in þe lufte : and oþure ase wel so heo,
In strongue fere comieth a-doun : and nutez &yogh;wodere teo,
And huy slez men bi þe weie : ase man may ofte I-seo—
þat muche fere god heom &yogh;yue : and no-þe worse us ne beo!
In oþur manere þare comez &yogh;eot harm : of þe þondre a-mong :
For þare ase þat weder is : þe tempeste is ful strong,
Of wynd, . of watur,. and of fuyr : þat þei þare were[MS. weren] þere
A Mulleston, he scholde al-to-driue : þei he of molten bras were.
&YOGH;wane þe tempeste is þare so strong : me þinchez, it nis no wonder
þei þare come leome ofte a-doun : with þe dunte of þe þonder;
&YOGH;wane þe wynd and þat fuyr smiteth : þoru&yogh; þe watur-cloude,
with swyþe grete strencþe it li&yogh;t a-doun : ase man mai i-huyre loude,
And smit ase it were a dunt : oþur blast of grete mi&yogh;te—
No wonder þei it smite harde : &yogh;wane it so deth a-li&yogh;te—
And brekez treon and quellez men : and deth gret oþur wonder.
In þis manere comez þe harm : þat men i-seoth of þe þonder.
Men I-seoth ofte li&yogh;tingue : brenne hous and schrenche,
þat vnneþe mai ani watur : þat fuyr þarof a-queenche;—
For of þe watur-cloude a-boue : þat fuyr is out i-brou&yogh;t
And for it out of þe watere comez : þat fuyr nele quenche nou&yogh;t.—
Nouþe mouwe &yogh;e Axi in &yogh;wuche manere : &yogh;water comez so hei&yogh;e,
And &yogh;warof comez rein and snov&yogh; : þat &yogh;e i-seoth with ei&yogh;e.
¶ þe sonne, þat is al maister here : sent a-doun hire hete
And makez þe wateres breþi up-ri&yogh;t : as þei huy scholden swete,
Boþe þe .sees. an ferchse wateres : and drau&yogh;th op so þane breth,
So þat a-boue in þe lufte : þilke mist euene geth.
Novþe is þare uppe in þe lufte : a swyþe cold stude, i-wis,
For bi-tweone heoue and eorþe : so cold non þare nis,
þare ase þe blake cloudene beoth : and oþur wederes al-so—
hit nis up-ri&yogh;t fram þe eorþe : bote Ane mile oþur two.
[Plunia.]&YOGH;wane þe sonne hath þudere i-drawe : þene mist for hete,
It ne may no feor for þe colde : ake bi-cometh al to wete,
And gaderez þare to one watur-cloude : and houeth þare ane stounde,
For-to þe tyme come þat it Ryne : and droppinde falle to grounde.
&YOGH;if it is cold up an hei&yogh; : þe dropen bi-cometh to snowe,[Nix.]
And þanne[al. As Grando.] huy freosez adoneward : are huy comen here ou&yogh;t lowe;
And &yogh;if it is þoru&yogh;-out cold : þat huy alle[al. al] i-frozen beo,
Þanne it is haul puyr : ase &yogh;e mouwen al day i-seo.
¶ þe breth of þe watere þat þe sonne : drau&yogh;th op a-&yogh;ein eue,
&yogh;wane þe sonne is to grounde i-go : it ne may nou&yogh;t bi-leue,
And &yogh;wane no-þing ne halt it up : and þe hete is al i-do,
[Ros.]þanne it fallez softe adoun : and to dewe bi-comez ri&yogh;t so,
And hangueth on leues and on gras : for-to þe hete a-morewe come
And þe sonne luyte and luyte : it habbe eft-sone up i-nome.
¶ þe hore-forst cometh &yogh;wane it is so cold : þat it freoseth a-ny&yogh;t,
And þe Dev freose a-doneward : &yogh;wane he is a-doun a-li&yogh;t.
¶ &YOGH;if þe Dev&yogh; is al-so up i-drawe : and a-doneward i-falle al-so
And þare come a þicke myst : and a cold forst þer-to,
þanne freost þe þicke Myst : and cleouez an hei&yogh; on þe treo:
[pruyna.]And þarof comez þe Rym-forst : ase þilke Mist deth fleo;
he cleouez on hegges al a-bovte : and In þe wodes al-so,
On treo, on stones, on bestes al-so : þare it may cleouien to—
I-chot wel, on mi fore-top : it hauez wel ofte i-do—.
In þis manere[MS. manere manere] &yogh;e mowen i-seo : þe kuynde of reyne and snowe,
Of hawel., of snov&yogh;[r. dev]., of Rym-forst : of hore-forst þat freost lowe,
Of cloudene and of Mist al-so— : for al o þing it is:
For alle huy comiez of water-breth : þat þe sonne drau&yogh;th up, i-wis.—
NOvþe is watur here on eorþe : wel more þane þe londe:
For sum o see, with-oute mo : is more, ich onder-stonde.
For þe gret . se . of occean : In þe on ende, i-wis,
Is more þane al þe eorþe beo : and gret wonder it is.[r. nis]
For a-boute al þe eorþe heo geth : and brod heo is þare-to,
Ase þe &yogh;wyte of þe Eye goth a-boute þe &yogh;eolke : and more is al-so.
Ech oþur . se . a-mong us here : ne beo heo so gret non,
Nis bote a lime of þulke se : and þudere In huy goth ech-on.
¶ Wellene comiez of grete wateres : and muche del of þe se
þoru&yogh; veynes al vnder eorþe : and to þe se wendez a&yogh;e.
For þare beoz ase it veynene weren : onder eorþe mani on,
þat sikeniez out of þe se : and þarof springueth þis wellene ech-on;
And þare-þoru&yogh; eornth þat watur faste : a-boute fram þe se,
And þare-ate wellen springuth out : and eft eorneth In a&yogh;e.
So þat for alle þe grete wateres : þat to þe se goth echon
Vnne[þe] is þe se eni-þing þe more : ake euere heo is bi on.
For ase swiþe it geth under eorþe : ase it comez in-to þe se,
And euere to wellene it geth a-brod : and eft-sone ernth in a&yogh;e;
And al-so sone ase ech watur comez : to þe se in is ende,
To þe grete se of occean : ase swiþe it deth i-wende.
Þare-fore [for] alle þe wateres : þat to þe se doth gon,
þe se mot nedlingus beo : euere-more bi on.
þat heo flowez and ebbez : and wexet In a þrowe,
þat is þoru&yogh; kuynde of þe mone : and ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t þoru&yogh; hire owe.
[Terra.]ÞE eorþe a-midde þe grete se : ase a luy[te] bal is round,
And puyr helle a-midde þe eorþe : ho-so sou&yogh;te þene ground.
And &yogh;eot ase gret ase þe eorþe þinchez : and ase luyte ase heo is,
þare nis bote þat seouenþe del : þat Men woniez on, i-wis.
For In þe north side here : ho-so lie nele,
For it is feor fram þe sonne : no Man ne wonez for chele,
Ne In þe south half noþe-mo : for þe grete hete
Of þe sonne þat is a-boue— : þe leomene beoth so grete[al. kete];
And manie oþur studes al-so : þei men mi&yogh;ten wonien þare-Inne,
huy ne berez noþur corn ne fruyt : Manne is mete to wynne.
And þei þe eorþe were al to-delt : ho-so mi&yogh;te bi Art,
&YOGH;eot nis þare, to wonien Inne : onneþe þe seuenþe part.—
Of þis foure elemenz : ech quic þing I-make is:
Of eorþe., of watur., and of þe eyr : and of fuyre, i-wis.
MAn hath of eorþe al is bodi : and of watere he hauez wete,
Of þe Eyr he hath breth and wind : of fuyr he hath hete.
Ech quic þing [hath] of alle þeos foure : of some more and lasse.
Ho-so hath of þe eorþe mest : he is slou&yogh; ase þe Asse,
Of fade colur, of hard huyde : boistous fourme and ded strong,
Of muche þou&yogh;t, of luyte speche : stille groyninde and wrath long,
Of slou&yogh; wreche and Aru&yogh; mouth[al. fereblet] : fast. and loth to gyue guod,
Sone old and nou&yogh;t willesfol : stable and studefast of mod.
Ho-so hath of þe watere mest : he schal beo &yogh;wit and fat al-so,
Of nesche her and no-þing crips : gret slepare and slov&yogh; þar-to,
Snvuelinde nose and wet mouth : of fewe wordes : and luyte drinke,
Of schorte wrathþe and de-bonere : Arv&yogh;. [al. fereblet]and luyte luste swinke.
¶ ho-so haueth of þe eir mest : he is of guod colour,
Fat and of nesche her : wel large and gret lechour,
Li&yogh;Inde and of glad semblaunt : and somdel of pruyte;
Habbe he mete and drinke I-nov&yogh; : he carez elles luyte;
Wrathþe he berth luytel &yogh;wyle : he wole beo ballede sone;
glad and bliþe, and onstable : of þat he hath to done.
¶ ho-so hath of fuyre mest : he is smal and red,
Oþur he is blac with cripse here : lene and sumdel qued,
Hinderful[al. hinder] and of bost I-nov&yogh; : hardi and ofte lie,
Sweriare and of manie word : and fol of lecherie,
Proud and wemod, and drinkare : and in wrathþe al-mest wod,
Hardi and li&yogh;t and stalewarde : and wakiare wel guod.
Ake euerech of þeos foure elemenz : en-tempriez oþur, i-wis,
So þat vnneþe In ani Man : any ri&yogh;[t] puyr maister is.
Ake[al. ase] &yogh;if þov nimst ri&yogh;t puyr hot watur : and dost cold þar-to,
þov mi&yogh;t it makien euene wlach : and entempri it so.—
¶ þo ore louerd formest made man : he made him, i-wis,
Of alle foure Elemens : ase man &yogh;eot i-mad is.
þo made he þe kuynde in eche manne : ase &yogh;e mouwe i-wite,
bi-twene Man and womman : of &yogh;wan we beoth bi-&yogh;ite.
A swyþe foul þing is þat sed : of &yogh;wan Man is i-spreind;
boþe Man and womman : to-gadere huy beoth i-meind.
Of &yogh;wij&yogh;t colour it bi-leuez : ase it is i-write,
for-to a-boute þe twelfte day : þat it was bi-&yogh;ite.
FOrmest þare keniez þar-of : smale bollene þreo,
Ake euerech hangez faste on oþur : ho-so it mi&yogh;te i-seo.
Of þe hexte bolle comez þat brayn : þe heorte of þane a-midde,
þe liuere, þat is neþemest : heo comez of þe þridde.
þis beoth þe þreo hexte limes[MS. limest] : þat formest i-kenede beoz,
And In heom is al ane Mannes lijf : ase [&yogh;e] nouþe i-seoth;
þare nis non of þulke þreo : þat hadde any wounde,
þat euereft mi&yogh;te I-held beo : to libbe anie stounde.
Aftur þe twelf formeste dawes : þat þet sed hath &yogh;wij&yogh;t i-beo,
hit bi-comez to a þicke blod : and chaungez al is bleo.
Hit þickez to[al. so] Nye dawes : for-to þe on and twentyþe day :
þanne it tornez formest to flesch : ase þe kuynde may.
Aftur ei&yogh;te and twenti dawes : fourme it bi-gynnez to nyme,
So þat In-with fourti dawes : it haueth euerech lime,
And in lasse &yogh;if it is a knaue : for he is of more hete.
&YOGH;wane þe limes beoth formest i-mad : huy ne beoz nou&yogh;t ful grete.
A smal weob it bi-cluppez al-a-boute : to holden it to-gadere faste,
Fram þat hit is formest i-kened : forto hit beo i-bore atþe laste.
¶ Al round it lith in þe wombe : and i-bouwed ase an hare
&YOGH;wane þat heo in fourme lith : for is .In. is sumdel nare.
Al I-buyd þe leggues beoz : it nolde nou&yogh;t elles fei&yogh;e,[al. veie]
þe helene to þe bottokes : þe kneuwene in eiþur ei&yogh;e;
þat heued is i-buid a-doneward : þe Armes al with-Inne,
þe elbouwes ri&yogh;t in þe schere : þe fustus to þe chinne;
Al i-buyd is þe rug : so þat nei&yogh; round it is.
Man, &yogh;war-of cometh þi pruyte? : for þare nis non, i-wis!
So hei&yogh; þov makest þe here : and to no man þou nelt a-buye :
Loke hov crekede[r. croked] þov were þare : and nouþe to no man þov nelt a-buye (!).
þou ne mi&yogh;test nou&yogh;t þo holde up þin heued : ne enes on-do þin ei&yogh;e;
Fra[orig. fram] &yogh;wam cam it sethþe þe : to beren þin heued so hei&yogh;e?
&YOGH;if man him wolde bi-þenche : and ri&yogh;t him onder-stonde,
he scholde beo meoke, and milde of heorte : and to no man habben onde.[vv. 734-5 al. om.]
IN eche manne þreo soulene beoth : ake nou&yogh;t alle I-liche guode,
[Anime.]Ase ich seide eov er of þreo bollene : &yogh;if &yogh;e it onder-stode.
In þe Neþemeste bolle : þat þe liuere deoth of springue,
þare comez o-manere soule : at þe bi-guynningue
Ase it were a-manere lijf : þat sent norischingue
To þe limes al-a-boute : and bi-ginnez[al. bringeth] in is wexingue;
So þat ane mannes norischingue : and is wexingue al-so
Of þulke furste soule comez : and of þe liuere þer-to.
þulke manere soule is : in ech wexinde þingue,
In treon and in gras al-so : huy ne mi&yogh;ten nou&yogh;t elles springue.
þoru&yogh; vertue of þulke soule : &yogh;wane it is þer-to i-brou&yogh;t
þat mannes lymes i-fourmede beoth : þat þare ne faillez nou&yogh;t,
þanne comez þare In þe heorte : þat þe oþur bolle was,
A soule þat bringuz þat lijf : þare it neuer er nas.
þat child is þanne quick a-non : ake strencþe nath it nou&yogh;t
Enes for-to wawie him : are hit beo feorrore i-brou&yogh;t.
Of þulke soule hath ech man : þat he mai wawi an gon
In is bi-guynningue,[al. Is velynge] and al is lijf : and is fif wittes ech-on.
þulke soule hath ech þing : þat vuel[al. vele] may ouer[al. oþer] -go,
Best, . and foul, and fisch al-so : worm and oþure mo.
þeos soule þat bringuez þat lijf : is ate heorte grounde :
þare-fore ho-so is þare i-smyte : he dei&yogh;ez in luyte stounde.
þeos soule comez of mannes cuynde : and þe oþere bi-fore al-so :
þare-fore, &yogh;wane a man dei&yogh;ez : huy dei&yogh;ez boþe-to.
&YOGH;eot þare is þe þridde soule : þat al heore maister is :
For &yogh;wane a child hath alle is limes : [&][om.] quike huy beoth, i-wis,
In þe ende of þe feorþe monþe : þat it was bi-&yogh;ite,
Oþur sone þar-aftur-ward : ase we findez i-write :
ÞE cuynde þat ore louerd made : and porueide al-so
þo he hadde Man formest I-mad : and in parays i-do,
To myenge þe kuynde of heuene : to mannes kuynde her,
And[al. Ane] soule of witte and of liue : þat is Aungelene i-pier,
heo comez fram þe kuynde of Aungles : and in þis fourme a-li&yogh;t
And miengez with þis wrechche flesch : ase ore louerd it hath i-di&yogh;t,
And makez þe kuynde þat nas er : bote ase a best onneþe
þe kuynde of aungles with him bere : for-to he come to deþe.
þulke soule nimth hire In : and bi-leuez, i-wis,
In þe childes brayn an hei&yogh; : þat is hexte lime is.
þulke soule i-last euere : and ne dei&yogh;e[z] neuere mo,
And went, &yogh;wane a man schal dei&yogh;e : to weole oþur to wo.
Al þat man hath bi-fore a best : oþur more resun can,
Al he it hath of þulke soule : &yogh;ware-þoru&yogh; he is man.
And &yogh;wane man went out of þis liue : þulke soule, i-wis,
Bi-guynnez departi fram þe bodie[MS. soule] : þe &yogh;wile he a-liue is,
And wend, ase heo hauez of-serued : to Ioye oþur to pine;
þe soulene þat hire ferene weren : beoth sone i-brou&yogh;t to fyne.
þulke þat halt ane Mannes lijf : and stikez in þe heorte,
&YOGH;wane heo schal with þe bodie [dei&yogh;e] : þat in strong Anguysche deth smeorte,
&YOGH;if he onder-&yogh;it his felawe : to Ioye fram him i-wende,
þare-fore heo maketh signe of Ioye : and deth as þe hiende;
And [&yogh;wan] heo deiez with þe bodie : fair chere heo makez and softe,
And bi-lef þat bodi in swych point : ase man may i-seon wel ofte :
þe ei&yogh;ene I-closede faire i-nov&yogh; : þe mouth of faire chere,
Ech lyme al-so faire i-strei&yogh;t : In guod poynt ase he were.
þe þridde soule al-so &yogh;eot : þat deiez atþen ende,
þat norischingue to al þat bodi : ant to þe limes deth sende,
he deth ane[al. ek] signe in þe bodie : &yogh;if is felawe geth to guode,
And bi-lefth þat bodi in fair hev : &yogh;wij&yogh;t oþur red of blode.
þeos soulene[al. soule] dei&yogh;ez in a man : &yogh;wane þe hete is al i-do,
þe raþur þat[al. þe erore whan] he leost is breth : and wawe&yogh;Ingue al-so.
&YOGH;wane huy i-seoz heore felawe : to torment i-brou&yogh;t,
Luþur semblaunt huy makiez boþe : as it ne likede heom nou&yogh;t,
And bi-leueth þat bodi in foule heowe : þe ei&yogh;ene stareInde,
And þe mouth of foul semblaunt : and ofte is[al. om.] grenninde.
Swuche signes þat fereliche beoth : þat man may ofte i-seo,
Beoth signes þat þe wrechche soule : in luþere weie beo.
Nov Iesu crist, þat us soule &yogh;af : graunte us þat we hire moten so here rede
þat seint Mi&yogh;hel hire mote a-fongue : and bi-fore to Ioye lede. Amen.
